intro: Thladiantha maculata, commonly known as the spotted bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers with distinctive white spots. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, sometimes glandular, leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Thladiantha maculata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
